title: How come iPhones are very slippery, and why is it that Apple didn't address this issue? - Quora

response.answer_text: Recent iPhone models are made from pretty premium material. Recent iPhone models like the 8, 8+ and X are the most premium iPhone in the whole iPhone line up. With glass back on all iPhone 8, 8+ and X. Aluminium frame on the 8 and 8+ but for the X, it’s stainless steel. So all these premium materials are pretty slippery. Even a more expensive and premium material like Titanium, Sapphire Glass, Ceramic ect. are slippery. If Apple were to address issues like you’ve asked, then their phone would feel like a Nokia phone. Made of plastic, polycarbonate or even rubber will make the phone feel super cheap. Best solution is to buy a skin or case which are good for grip.

I agree with you a biT but based on my experience I found that the premium flagship phones are very rich premium delicate to hold ,to touch and feel. the feeling is something out of the world. i assume you must be moving from a simple to flagship device.
